title: Gideon Defeats Midian
summary: In Judges 7, God reduces Gideon’s army to just 300 men to show that victory comes from Him. Using torches, trumpets, and jars, Gideon’s small force surprises the Midianites and wins without a traditional battle.

faq.question: Why did God shrink Gideon’s army?
faq.answer: So that Israel wouldn’t boast that they won by their own strength.

faq.question: What strategy did the 300 men use?
faq.answer: They blew trumpets, smashed jars, and shouted—causing confusion in the enemy camp.
